summary: This document is a telephone call detail record (CDR) log from August 9, 2019, showing 36 call records. The calls are all of type 'ONE LINE' with status 'BARGE REQUEST', indicating they may be part of a monitored or recorded line, possibly from a detention or correctional facility. The data includes technical telephony fields but no named individuals or substantive conversation content. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 9, 2019, showing numerous short-duration calls with technical routing data. The log records call attempts with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST', which may indicate attempts to monitor or join calls, potentially from a detention or correctional facility. This document is a telephone call log from August 9, 2019, showing a series of very short calls (1-4 seconds) with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST'. It appears to be a technical log of call attempts or monitoring activity, possibly from a detention or correctional facility, given the repeated 'BARGE' status and internal station numbers. This document is a detailed telephone call log from a correctional facility, showing numerous short-duration calls made on August 9-10, 2019. The calls are all flagged as 'BARGE REQUEST' and originate from various internal stations, suggesting they are likely inmate calls being monitored or intercepted. The consistent '333 IN' authorization code indicates a controlled environment. This document is a technical telephone call log from a system, showing a series of very short calls (mostly 1-2 seconds) with status 'BARGE REQUEST' originating from various caller stations. The log covers calls from August 10-11, 2019, and appears to be a record of system activity, possibly from a detention or monitoring facility, given the timing shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death. This document is a telephone call log from August 11, 2019, showing a series of very short calls (mostly 1-3 seconds) with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST'. It appears to be a technical log of call attempts, possibly from a detention facility or monitored environment, on the day Jeffrey Epstein died. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 11, 2019, showing numerous short-duration calls with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST'. It appears to be a technical record of call attempts or monitoring activity, likely from a detention or correctional facility, given the context of the Epstein case and the date being the day of his death.

events.title: Telephone Call Logging
events.description: A series of 36 telephone calls were logged on a system, all with the status 'BARGE REQUEST', which typically indicates a call monitoring or recording feature was activated.

events.title: Series of Call Attempts
events.description: A series of 35 telephone call attempts (records 37-71) were logged throughout the afternoon and evening. Each call is very brief, typically lasting 1-3 seconds, and has a call status of 'BARGE REQUEST'.

events.title: Series of Barge Request Calls
events.description: A sequence of over 80 very brief telephone calls, all with a 'BARGE REQUEST' status, logged throughout the evening of August 9, 2019.

events.title: Series of Monitored Calls
events.description: A series of short-duration telephone calls (1-3 seconds each) were made from various internal stations, all logged as 'BARGE REQUEST' with authorization code '333 IN'.

events.title: Continued Series of Monitored Calls
events.description: Continuation of short-duration telephone calls logged as 'BARGE REQUEST' from various internal stations, including a cluster of calls around 23:28.

events.title: Series of 'BARGE REQUEST' calls logged
events.description: A telephone system log records multiple calls with the status 'BARGE REQUEST' originating from various stations, starting late on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Continued 'BARGE REQUEST' call activity
events.description: The telephone log shows a high volume of very short 'BARGE REQUEST' calls continuing through the early morning hours of August 11, 2019.

events.title: Series of Short 'Barge Request' Calls
events.description: A log of numerous telephone calls, each lasting only 1-3 seconds, with a call status of 'BARGE REQUEST' recorded throughout the morning of August 11, 2019.

events.title: Telephone Call Log Activity
events.description: A series of short-duration telephone calls, many lasting only 1-2 seconds, were logged throughout the day with a status of 'BARGE REQUEST'.

keyFacts: The document is a call detail record (CDR) log dated August 9, 2019, containing 36 individual call records.
All calls logged have a 'Call Type' of 'ONE LINE' and a 'Call Status' of 'BARGE REQUEST', which is a feature allowing a third party to join or monitor a call.
The data includes technical telephony fields like caller station numbers, circuit IDs, and switch IDs, but contains no named individuals, conversation content, or dialed phone numbers.
The consistent 'BARGE REQUEST' status suggests these calls may have been placed from a monitored environment, such as a detention facility.
The document appears to be a raw data export from a telephone system, likely obtained as part of an investigation.
The call log covers a specific date: August 9, 2019, from approximately 4:16 PM to 7:01 PM.

The calls are extremely short, most lasting only 1-2 seconds, suggesting failed connection attempts or automated monitoring pings.
